channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car park opposite Coperfield Court Chapel Hill needs sweeping, 29th December
item.description:
The car park of the car home opposite Coperfield Court Chapel Hill needs sweeping of rubbish and leaves. Please can this be completed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapel Hill, Crayford, Greater London

item.title: 3 bins near gates to Heritage Gate Estate, Weir Rd Bexley, 29th December
item.description:
It's near the entrance to the gates of heritage gate estate on Weir Rd . On the immediate left hand side as you turn into Weir Rd . There's three bins on their own and can't be missed as they're in plain site against the wall . Other complaints about these bins were made weeks ago by other residents of the area .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dip in kerb does not align with width of drive, making access difficult, 29th December
item.description:
Where the kerb dips to allow car access to our driveway is narrower than the actual driveway. As you can see in the photos, if we reversed the car on to the road in a straight line, we would hit raised kerb/plants. We have to swing the car round and reverse at an angle to get out. Next door have 2 cars and a narrow drive due to their front garden, which means they are always parked right to the edge of their half of the shared space. The combination makes it awkward to get the car on/off the drive. We would like to request that the dip in the pavement is widened on our side to align with the width of our driveway to solve this problem. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Wickham Way, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover damaged, 29th December

item.title: Passing places blocked, 29th December
item.description:

item.title: Broken fence, 29th December
item.description:
This has been broken for several weeks. Makes the street look uncared for. Not sure if it was broken by accident or an act of vandalism. Also, the green area behind the fence, which is council controlled, gets full of rubbish and noise from the road and bus stop. Could 1.5m hedges be put there to improve the area?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Hall Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
